bcl:definition.bcl:text: collector includes a person appointed as a collector of taxes under the Local Government Act, the Taxation (Rural Area) Act, the Vancouver Charter or any other Act that authorizes the assessment and levy of taxes on real property;
financing statement means a financing statement as defined in the Personal Property Security Act;
former Act means the Manufactured Home Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 280;
instrument includes a document in writing by which property in a manufactured home may be transferred or acquired;

manufactured home means any structure, whether ordinarily equipped with wheels or not, that is designed, constructed or manufactured to provide residential accommodation and to be moved from one place to another by being towed or carried;

owner means a person entitled to be registered in the register as the owner of a manufactured home, whether entitled in the person's own right or in a representative capacity or otherwise, and includes

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a debtor under a security agreement providing for a security interest in a manufactured home, and
a lessor-owner and a lessee-owner,

bcl:definition.bcl:text: but does not include a secured party, other than a lessor-owner, under a security agreement providing for a security interest in a manufactured home;
property means any right, title or interest of an owner in a manufactured home;

register, when used as a noun, means the information filed with the registrar under this Act or filed with or registered by the registrar under the former Act, including any corrections and notations made to that information by the registrar under this or the former Act;
registrar means the registrar appointed under section 2;
registration number means the number assigned to a manufactured home by the registrar at the time of registration;
secured party means a secured party under a security agreement;
security agreement means a security agreement to which section 2 of the Personal Property Security Act applies;
security interest means an interest in a manufactured home that secures payment or performance of an obligation;
serial number means the serial number that the manufacturer permanently marked on or attached to the manufactured home.

bcl:section.bcl:text: A registrar, and the officers and employees necessary to enable the registrar to perform the registrar's duties, must be appointed under the Public Service Act.
The registrar may delegate, in writing, a function of the registrar to an employee in the public service.
The registrar may have a seal of office.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Procedure for registration and issue of decals

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In order to register ownership of a manufactured home, the owner must submit for filing with the registrar a notice of ownership in the form established by the registrar and in the manner set out in the regulations.
If the notice conforms with subsection (3), the registrar must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: file the notice,
register the name of the owner of the manufactured home and the interest claimed by the owner, and
assign a registration number to the manufactured home.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The notice must set out the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the name and address of the owner;
in the case of an application by a lessor-owner or a lessee-owner, the names and addresses of the lessor-owner and the lessee-owner;
the year of manufacture, the make or model and the serial number of the manufactured home;
the current location of the manufactured home;
other information required by the regulations.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The notice must be accompanied by any other records required by the regulations.

On registration of ownership of a manufactured home, the registrar must issue to the owner one or more decals bearing its registration number and the owner of the manufactured home must affix them, in the prescribed location, to the manufactured home.
Registration of a person as a lessor-owner of a manufactured home does not affect the priority status of the interest of the person under the Personal Property Security Act.
On application filed by the registered owner, if a decal issued under section 5 is stolen, lost, defaced, mutilated or destroyed, the registrar must issue a new decal.
An application under subsection (1)

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: must be in the form established by the registrar,
must state the circumstances of the theft, loss, defacement, mutilation or destruction of the decal, and
must indicate the class of decal requested by the applicant.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If property in a manufactured home is transferred, a person may submit for filing a notice of transfer in the form established by the registrar and in accordance with the regulations.

The regulations may require that notices respecting particular classes of transfers be submitted for filing only through persons specified by regulation or designated as qualified suppliers by the registrar.
The notice must set out the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the name and address of the new owner;
the name of the current registered owner, or

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: of the lessor-owner in the case of the transfer of the lessor-owner's property, or
of the lessee-owner in the case of the transfer of the lessee-owner's property;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the registration number of the manufactured home;
the current location of the manufactured home;
other information required by the regulations.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The notice must be accompanied by any other records required by the regulations.

The regulations may require persons specified or designated for the purposes of subsection (2) who file records in the registry to provide copies of the records to other persons or to retain copies of the records for a prescribed period.
A notice of transfer of a manufactured home must not be submitted for filing unless ownership of the manufactured home is registered under this Act.

Except as against the person making it, an instrument purporting to transfer property in a manufactured home is not effective to transfer property in the manufactured home unless a notice of transfer in the form established by the registrar is filed with the registrar.
The giving of a security interest in a manufactured home does not sever a joint tenancy in the manufactured home.
Subsections (7) and (8) are subject to the Land Title Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Filing of notice, application or other record

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A notice, application or other record required or permitted, by this Act, to be filed with the registrar

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: must be submitted to the registrar for filing in the prescribed manner and accompanied by the prescribed fee,
must be in a form established by or acceptable to the registrar,
must, in the opinion of the registrar, be legible and suitable for photographing or for electronic or digital imaging or storage, and
must be in the English language or be filed with an English translation verified in a manner satisfactory to the registrar.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A notice, application or other record is filed with the registrar when the registrar

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is satisfied that the notice, application or other record and information contained in it appear to meet the requirements of this Act and the regulations, and
accepts the notice, application or other record and includes in the register the information contained in the record.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a record is filed with the registrar under this Act or is otherwise maintained by the registrar, the registrar may have the record

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: photographed, or
stored in electronic or digital form or reproduced in any other prescribed manner.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A photograph, stored record or reproduction referred to in subsection (1) must be considered for all purposes to be the record photographed, stored or reproduced.

If the information contained in a record filed with or otherwise maintained by the registrar in paper form under this Act is converted into another form under subsection (1), the registrar may destroy the paper form records.
Despite any other provision of this Act, the registrar may refuse to file a notice, application or other record submitted to the registrar for filing if, in the opinion of the registrar,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the notice, application or other record is not complete due to an omission or misdescription,
the notice, application or other record does not comply with the requirements of this Act or the regulations,
the notice, application or other record contains any error, alteration or erasure, or
another notice, application or record that, under this Act, must be filed in conjunction with the notice, application or other record has not yet been submitted for filing.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The registrar is not under any duty to determine any of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the authenticity or accuracy of the signature of a person named in a record filed under this Act;
the identity of a person named in a record filed under this Act;
whether an application or other record filed with the registrar, or the information contained in it, meets the requirements of this Act and the regulations.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Power of registrar to correct register

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: On an application or on the initiative of the registrar, the registrar may correct an error or omission in the register if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the registrar is satisfied that an error or omission exists, and
the registrar is satisfied as to the true facts that ought to have been incorporated into the register.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsection (1) applies whether or not the error or omission was made by

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a person who submitted a record to the registrar for filing, or
the registrar.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Any correction made by the registrar under this section must be shown on the register as a correction, with the date and time of the correction noted by the registrar.
The corrected register and every corrected entry have validity and effect from the making of the correction as if the error or omission had not existed.

bcl:section.bcl:text: On application of a registered owner and on the registrar being satisfied that the name of that owner has been changed, the registrar must record in the register the new name of the registered owner.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the registrar is required to produce a record and is unable to do so because it has been lost, mislaid or destroyed, the registrar must give to the court or person making the requisition a record to that effect.
The registrar may produce, instead of the record, whatever evidence relating to the record is available to the registrar.
Evidence produced under subsection (2) is compliance with the requisition.

bcl:section.bcl:text: A record to which this Act applies is not invalidated or made ineffective merely by a defect, irregularity, omission or error in it or in its execution unless, in the opinion of the court, the defect, irregularity, omission or error has actually misled a person whose interest is affected.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to the regulations, a person must not move a manufactured home unless

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: ownership of the manufactured home is registered under this Act,
the registrar has issued a transport permit authorizing the manufactured home to be moved, and
the manufactured home is moved to the location, and in accordance with the terms and conditions, set out in the transport permit.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: On application, in the form established by the registrar and in the manner set out in the regulations, of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a registered owner of a manufactured home,

a landlord, under an order of possession granted under section 48 or 49 of the Manufactured Home Park Tenancy Act or in the exercise of a right conferred on the landlord under a regulation of that Act respecting disposal of abandoned personal property,
a secured party, or
any other person under an order of a court,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the registrar must,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: on being satisfied that a certificate or confirmation in electronic format has been issued under section 25 of this Act, and

if the application is for a transport permit to remove a manufactured home from British Columbia, on being satisfied that no grants or mortgages have been made under the Home Purchase Assistance Act for the manufactured home, and no agreements have been made under the Home Mortgage Assistance Program Act, under which the government is entitled to repayment,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: issue a transport permit authorizing the manufactured home to be moved to the location, and in accordance with the terms and conditions, set out in the transport permit.

If an application is made by a landlord under subsection (2) (b), the registrar must not decline to issue a transport permit merely because the taxes on the manufactured home are due, in default, in arrears or delinquent, so long as the registrar is satisfied that the collector having taxing authority over the manufactured home has consented to the issue of the transport permit.
A collector must not unreasonably withhold consent under subsection (3) if the collector is satisfied that the manufactured home will not be transported out of the taxing jurisdiction.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Notice of application for transport permit

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The registrar must send notice of an application for a transport permit to

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a lessee-owner, when the application is made by a lessor-owner, and
a secured party revealed by a search of the personal property registry using the manufactured home registration number.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The notice must specify the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the name of the applicant;
the location to which the manufactured home is to be transported;
other information required by the registrar.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to the regulations and unless otherwise stated in it, a transport permit expires 30 days after the date it was issued.

The registrar may, subject to the regulations, issue a transport permit subject to any conditions the registrar considers necessary to facilitate the transportation of a manufactured home from one location to another.
If a transport permit is issued subject to conditions, a person must not move the manufactured home otherwise than in accordance with the conditions.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Sale or transport of unregistered manufactured home prohibited

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person must not import into British Columbia, sell, offer for sale or move a manufactured home unless the ownership of the manufactured home is registered under this Act.
This section does not apply to a manufactured home that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is owned by the government, a Crown corporation or agency or by a municipality and is occupied by or for the purposes of the government, the Crown corporation or agency or the municipality, or
is exempted from this section by regulation or by the registrar.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Unauthorized change in location of manufactured home

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the location of a manufactured home on the register is corrected under section 11 (1), the registrar may

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: send a notice of the change to

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the collector having taxing authority over the manufactured home at the location on the register before the change, and
a secured party revealed by a search of the personal property registry using the manufactured home registration number, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: send notice to the present registered owner requiring the registered owner to

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: complete any form established by the registrar to process the change in location, or
satisfy the registrar that the change in location was made

bcl:clause.bcl:text: in compliance with this Act and the regulations, or
by someone other than the present registered owner.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If, within 60 days of the registrar sending notice to the registered owner under subsection (1) (b), the registrar has not received the form, if any, or been satisfied that the change in location was made in compliance with this Act and the regulations or made by someone other than the registered owner, the registrar may

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: decline to file a notice of transfer, and
decline to issue a transport permit.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person may request one or more of the following in the manner set out in the regulations:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a search according to the name of a person and the issue of a search result;
a search according to the serial number of a manufactured home and the issue of a search result;
a search according to the registration number of a manufactured home and the issue of a search result.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The registrar may provide a copy or a certified copy of a record that is in paper form or electronic form in the register.
Without proof of the signature, seal or official position of the registrar, a certified copy referred to in subsection (2) is admissible in evidence as a true copy of the original record.
The signature of the registrar on a certified copy referred to in subsection (3) may be reproduced by any means, whether graphic, electronic, digital, mechanical or otherwise.
A record issued or provided under this section is evidence of any of the matters stated in the record that relate to the register.

In accordance with the regulations, the registrar may, on application of a person, order that a manufactured home is exempted from this Act, or a provision of it, on terms and conditions the registrar imposes.
A person may apply to the registrar in the form established by the registrar for an exemption order or to vary or cancel an order previously made.

The regulations may require that applications respecting particular classes of exemptions be submitted for filing only through persons specified by regulation or designated as qualified suppliers by the registrar.

The regulations may require persons specified or designated for the purposes of subsection (3) who file records in the registry to provide copies of the records to other persons or to retain copies of the records for a prescribed period.
The registrar may, on application of a person, vary or cancel all or part of an order made under subsection (1).

If an order is made under this section, the registrar must record the exemption of the manufactured home, or a variation or cancellation of an order made under this section, by notation in the register.

A person who has commenced or is a party to a proceeding, and is making a claim to property in a manufactured home, may submit for filing a caution in the form established by the registrar, together with a copy of the writ, notice or pleading in which the person claims the interest.
The registrar must file the caution or any court order continuing or cancelling the caution.
A caution expires 3 months after it is filed unless within that period the court, on application, orders that the caution be

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: cancelled, or
continued until a further order is made or until the end of a period set by the court for determining that person's rights under the caution.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A continuation order under subsection (3) (b) must be filed with the registrar before the caution expires.
The person who filed or continued the filing of a caution may withdraw it at any time by notice in writing to the registrar.

In this section, manufactured home park means land used or occupied by a person for the purpose of providing space for the accommodation of 3 or more manufactured homes and for imposing a charge or rental for the use of that space.

If a person moves a manufactured home to a manufactured home park, or purchases a manufactured home that has never been occupied and that is located in a manufactured home park, the manufactured home is not part of the land that forms the manufactured home park unless a written agreement that the manufactured home is part of the land

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is entered into by

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: every registered owner of the manufactured home,

every person with a security interest in the manufactured home who has registered a financing statement in the personal property registry under the Personal Property Security Act using the registration number assigned under this Act or, if the manufactured home is not currently registered under this Act, the serial number of the manufactured home, and
every person who is registered in the land title office as an owner of the fee simple interest in the land, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is filed with the registrar.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Access to register by taxing authority

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The officers of any taxing authority are entitled, without charge, to search the register in respect of manufactured homes located on land over which it has authority, for the purposes of taxation, assessment and incidental matters.
For the purposes of subsection (1), any person approved by the registrar and employed by the taxing authority has access to the register.

If the officers of a taxing authority so request, the registrar may provide any information in the register required by them at a charge to be set in each case by the registrar, on the basis of reasonable compensation to the government for the cost of providing the information.
Unless the regulations provide otherwise, the registrar must not issue a transport permit under section 15 unless satisfied that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the collector having taxing authority over the manufactured home has issued a certificate or confirmed in electronic format that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: no taxes on the manufactured home are in arrears or delinquent, and
no taxes for the current year, that were imposed or are deemed to have been imposed, are unpaid, or

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the requirements of section 26 (1) have been met.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: On request, a collector must provide the certificate or confirmation in electronic format if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: no taxes on the manufactured home are in arrears or delinquent and no taxes for the current year, that were imposed or are deemed to have been imposed, are unpaid, or
the requirements of section 26 (1) have been met.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The certificate or confirmation must be provided free and must contain the date to which the taxes have been paid.
Despite the Local Government Act, the Taxation (Rural Area) Act or the Vancouver Charter, if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a tax notice in respect of taxes imposed on a manufactured home for the current year has not been mailed to the person liable for them, and
a person, other than a landlord

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: under an order of possession granted under section 47 of the Manufactured Home Park Tenancy Act, or
in the exercise of a right conferred on the person under a regulation of that Act respecting disposal of abandoned personal property,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: has requested the collector to issue a certificate or confirmation in electronic format for the purpose of section 25 (1) of this Act,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the collector must issue a certificate or confirmation if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: there are no taxes in arrears or delinquent in respect of the manufactured home, and
the person making the request has paid to the collector a deposit in the prescribed amount.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Despite the Local Government Act, the Taxation (Rural Area) Act and the Vancouver Charter, if a person, other than a landlord

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: under an order of possession granted under section 47 of the Manufactured Home Park Tenancy Act, or
in the exercise of a right conferred on the person under a regulation of that Act respecting disposal of abandoned personal property,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: has requested the collector to issue a certificate or confirmation in electronic format for the purpose of section 25 (1) of this Act for a manufactured home in respect of which a tax notice or statement has been mailed to the person liable for the taxes, the collector may decline to issue the certificate or confirmation until all taxes due, in arrears or delinquent have been paid.

Payments accepted under subsection (1) (d) bear interest at the prescribed annual rate and the payments and interest must be applied and credited by the collector against the current year's taxes imposed on the manufactured home in respect of which the payment was made.

A person not primarily liable for taxes in respect of a manufactured home who is the holder of a security interest in the manufactured home and pays the taxes in order to obtain a transport permit under section 15 is entitled

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: to add the amount paid to the principal money secured by the security interest, or
to deduct the amount from rent, purchase price or other money payable under the instrument in respect of which the person claims registration.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An amount paid under subsection (1) bears interest at the prescribed annual rate from the date of payment.
The person who has paid the taxes under subsection (1) has, in respect of the amount paid, a lien against the manufactured home.
The lien under subsection (3) has priority over any security interest in the manufactured home, except a claim of the government.

The lien under subsection (3) ceases to exist after the expiry of 15 days from the date the taxes were paid unless, before that date, the lien is registered in the personal property registry in the form and manner prescribed under the Personal Property Security Act.
The priority provided under subsection (4) does not apply with respect to the interest of a secured party who,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: at the date the taxes were paid, held a perfected security interest in the manufactured home, and
has not been given written notice of the lien before the expiry of 60 days from the date the taxes were paid.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The notice under subsection (6) may be given in accordance with section 72 of the Personal Property Security Act or by registered mail addressed to the address of the person to be notified as it appears in the security agreement or in the financing statement that relates to the manufactured home and that is registered in the personal property registry.
The amount and any interest paid under subsections (1) and (2) is a debt recoverable by action by the person paying the taxes against the person who is primarily liable.

A holder of a security interest who pays the amount of the taxes with interest to the date of payment to the person referred to in subsection (1) is subrogated to all of the rights and priorities held by that person.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tax lien by the government or a municipality

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If taxes in respect of a manufactured home imposed under the Local Government Act, the Taxation (Rural Area) Act, the Vancouver Charter or Part 2 of the Drainage, Ditch and Dike Act have become due, the collector may, whenever the taxes and any related interest or penalties remain unpaid, register a financing statement in the personal property registry established under the Personal Property Security Act in the form and manner prescribed under that Act.
Sections 18, 43 (1) to (3), (6) to (8), (12) and (13), 46 to 48, 51, 52 and 54 of the Personal Property Security Act apply to registrations under subsection (1) of this section.

On registration of a financing statement under subsection (1), a lien for the unpaid taxes and any related interest and penalty is created on the manufactured home to which the registration relates and the lien continues as long as the registration is effective.
The lien under subsection (3) has priority over any security interest, charge or claim, except a claim of the government.

A collector who has registered a financing statement under subsection (1) must give a copy of the financing statement to each person registered under section 5 as owner of the manufactured home to which the registration relates.

The copy of the financing statement referred to in subsection (5) and the written notice referred to in section 29 (2) may be given in accordance with section 72 of the Personal Property Security Act or sent by registered mail to the person's address as it appears in the records of the register, in which case section 72 (2) of the Personal Property Security Act applies.
A registration of a financing statement under subsection (1) is effective until discharged

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: by registration of a financing change statement, or
as provided in section 29 (1) or (2).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: When the unpaid taxes, interest and penalties, if any, charged against the manufactured home in respect of which a registration has been made under section 28 (1) have been paid, the collector must discharge the registration.

If the collector fails to discharge the registration as required in subsection (1), the person registered under section 5 as owner of the manufactured home to which the registration relates may require the registrar of the personal property registry to give a written notice to the collector stating that the registration will be discharged by the registrar on the expiry of 40 days after the day the registrar gives the notice to the collector, unless in the meantime the collector gives the registrar a court order maintaining the registration.
If the collector has been given a notice under subsection (2) and fails to

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: register a financing change statement discharging the registration, or
obtain a court order maintaining the registration and give the order to the registrar

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: before the expiry of the 40 days referred to in subsection (2), the registrar of the personal property registry may discharge the registration to which the notice relates.
On application by the collector, the court may order that the registration referred to in subsection (2) be maintained or discharged.

On application by a collector, a court may make an order to protect or enforce a lien on a manufactured home, including an order that the manufactured home be delivered to a collector or that the manufactured home be seized by the collector.

Even if a manufactured home has been delivered to or seized by a collector under subsection (5), it must not be sold or otherwise disposed of in a manner other than in compliance with the Act under which the taxes were levied.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Application of other Acts to tax collection in respect of manufactured homes

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: When a collector seizes or otherwise takes possession of a manufactured home, section 17 (2) and (3) (a) and (b) of the Personal Property Security Act applies.

Taxes levied in respect of a manufactured home are recoverable in any manner in which taxes are recoverable under the Local Government Act, the Taxation (Rural Area) Act, the Vancouver Charter or any other Act.

Subject to the Manufactured Home Tax Act, a manufactured home, whether or not it falls within the definition of an improvement under the Assessment Act, the Local Government Act, the School Act, the Taxation (Rural Area) Act, the Vancouver Charter or any other Act, is an improvement for the purpose of real property assessment and taxation and, except as provided in section 3 of the Manufactured Home Tax Act, the manufactured home must be assessed and taxed in the name of the owner of the land on which the manufactured home is located at the time of assessment.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Filing of certificate of collector enforceable as a judgment of the Supreme Court

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: When default is made in the payment of taxes due and payable with respect to a manufactured home under the Local Government Act, the Taxation (Rural Area) Act, the Vancouver Charter or any other Act, the collector may file a certificate with any district registrar of the Supreme Court.

A certificate filed under subsection (1) has the same effect and proceedings may be taken on it as if it were a judgment of the court for the recovery of a debt of the amount stated in the certificate against the person named in it.
The certificate filed under subsection (1) must contain

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the registration number of the manufactured home,
the amount of taxes and related interest or penalties owing in respect of the manufactured home, and
the name and address of the taxing authority to which the taxes are owing.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Unless the manufactured home complies in all respects with the standards prescribed by regulation at the time it was manufactured or is exempted from this section by the regulations or by the registrar, a person must not move, sell, offer for sale or advertise for sale a previously unoccupied manufactured home or a manufactured home that was manufactured after May 15, 1992.

A regulation made under subsection (1) may incorporate by reference, with changes the Lieutenant Governor in Council considers necessary, all or part of any code or standard respecting manufactured homes.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Disclosure statement to be provided to prospective purchaser

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person must not sell or offer for sale a used or previously occupied manufactured home unless

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person discloses in writing to any prospective purchaser whether or not the manufactured home complies with the standards prescribed by regulation, or
the manufactured home is exempted from this section by the regulations or by the registrar.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsection (1) does not apply if the person discloses in writing to any prospective purchaser that the manufactured home was manufactured on or before May 15, 1992.
The registrar must promptly give the applicant a notice of refusal if the registrar refuses

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: to file a record submitted for filing, or
to do any other thing that the registrar is authorized or required to do under this Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The notice of refusal must briefly state the reasons and the registrar's further requirements.
If a subsequent application or other record submitted for filing is affected by the registrar's refusal, the registrar must similarly notify the subsequent applicant.
A person directly affected by a refusal referred to in section 34 may appeal the refusal to the court.
The registrar is a party to an appeal under subsection (1).
An appeal under subsection (1) is an appeal on the record.
For the purposes of subsection (3), the record consists of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: copies or originals of documentary evidence before the registrar;
other things received as evidence by the registrar;
the notice of refusal.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An appeal under subsection (1) must be commenced not more than 30 days after the earliest of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the mailing to the applicant, at the applicant's most recent address known to the registrar, of a notice of the refusal that is being appealed;
actual notice to the applicant of the refusal that is being appealed.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: At least 10 days before the date set for the hearing of an appeal under subsection (1), the appellant must serve on all interested parties, including the registrar, a notice of the hearing of the appeal together with copies of all material and exhibits that constitute the record.
The court may make any order it considers necessary as to notification of other parties to the hearing.
On hearing the appeal, the court may make any order that the circumstances may require and the court considers proper.

bcl:section.bcl:text: A record may be served on the registrar by leaving it at the registrar's office or by mailing it by registered mail to the registrar's office.
Section 5 of the Offence Act does not apply to this Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (2), a person who makes or assists in making a statement that is included in a record required or permitted to be made by or for the purposes of this Act or the regulations commits an offence if the statement

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is, at the time and in light of the circumstances under which it is made, false or misleading in respect of any material fact, or
omits any material fact, the omission of which makes the statement false or misleading.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person is not guilty of an offence under subsection (1) if that person

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: did not know that the statement was false or misleading, and
with the exercise of reasonable diligence, could not have known that the statement was false or misleading.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A registered owner who fails to affix, or knowingly fails to keep affixed, in the prescribed manner a decal, issued under section 5 or 6, to the manufactured home in respect of which the decal is issued commits an offence.
A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) or (3) is liable to a fine of not more than $2 000.
A person who contravenes section 15 (1), 17 (3), 18 (1), 32 (1) or 33 (1) commits an offence and is liable to a fine of not more than $2 000.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Registrar may temporarily close registry if circumstances require

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Despite any regulation under this Act, if the registrar considers that it is not practicable to provide one or more of the registrar's services, the registrar may suspend, for a period, any or all of the services provided or functions performed by the registrar, including

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: filing any records, and
allowing searches and issuing search results.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A suspension order under subsection (1) may be made before, during or after the period to which the suspension relates.
The Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations referred to in section 41 of the Interpretation Act.
Without limiting subsection (1), the Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: respecting the services or functions to be provided by the registrar;
respecting the form of the register and the manner in which it is kept;
respecting the form and content of the information to be included in any name or address required under this Act;
respecting any matter the registrar considers necessary for carrying out the purposes of this Act, including matters in respect of which

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: an express provision has not been made, or
only partial or imperfect provision has been made;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: defining any word or expression used but not defined in this Act;
setting fees for the purposes of this Act;
for the purposes of, and under the prescribed conditions for, exempting manufactured homes from the operation of this Act or any provision of this Act,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: by class, use or intended use, or
in respect of any transaction or class of transactions governed by this Act;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: respecting the exercise of powers by the registrar under section 21;
respecting decals and providing for different classes of decals;
respecting moving a manufactured home and respecting transport permits;
requiring a collector to issue a receipt for the payment of a deposit under section 26 (1) (d).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Under subsection (2), the Lieutenant Governor in Council may prescribe different manners, methods and requirements for different categories of records, information and situations.

bcl:section.bcl:text: This Act comes into force by regulation of the Lieutenant Governor in Council.
